item.title: Report X-2025050979
item.description:
Report X-2025050979

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-12
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: John Santos, Operations Supervisor, called Safety to report a spill in trailer 555078 of UN1263, PAINT, 3, PG II. John stated the 5-gallon pail of paint appears to have been damaged during transit by other freight. John stated the 5-gallon pail looks to have spilled 1 gallon of paint on the trailer floor and on the side of the skid. John stated he would stop work and wait for the cleaning crew to assist with the cleanup of the spill in the trailer.

item.title: Report E-2025050519
item.description:
Report E-2025050519

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 00:11 AM ET, Morgan with UDV contacted the call center to request assistance with a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Henderson, CO. The spill consists of approximately 10 ounces of Infused, which released from a 1 275-gallon plastic tote due to a loose lid that caused the product to slosh around and spill on the top of the tote and on the trailer floor. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist, as this is a corrosive liquid inside of a tote. No SDS could be located for this product. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-ounces of UN3264 Infused product released from a 275-gallon plastic tote to the top of the tote and an area of the wooden trailer floor (4’x4’) due to improper packaging & a loose cap. The crew used absorbents to collect and containerize the spill and generated (1) 5-pound poly drum containing impacted absorbents and PPE. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025060023
item.description:
Report E-2025060023

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-02
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2237 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UDV. It was reported that approximately 1 oz of "ConvoClean Forte" was released from 2 plastic jugs due to a packaging defect. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3214872. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately (5) 2.5-gallons of UN1814 ConvoClean Fote product released to the wooden trailer floor and concrete dock floor impacting area 10’x10’ area. The contractors found multiple cartons on a pallet, must jugs were intact but the cartons were impacted. There were (5) drums generated, (1) 95-gallon poly drum containing damaged bottles, (1) 55-gallon poly drum with damaged bottles, (2) 55-poly drums containing damaged cardboard, and (1) 35-gallon poly drum with damaged cardboard. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2025051186

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: PUEBLO
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Network 2.0...FXG Hazmat pouch on the box, DOT SP 8757 & SDS in the pouch. Three metal cylinders wrapped in absorbent pads laying on their sides, all 3 leaked from the top. CANNOT DETERMINE THE AMOUNT BECAUSE THERE IS NO DG PAPERWORK. All 3 bottles are marked with the following: 1. World Fuel Services 1739 Platteville, Blvd. Pueblo West, CO 81007 (individual's name and email address) 1. BTL 1 GASOLINE 65% B81.5B 25% ETHANOL 10% 2. BTL 2 B81.5B 90% ETHANOL 10% 3. BTL3 GASOLINE P66 90% ETHANOL 10% All contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for disposition from the shipper.

item.description:
Report E-2025050067

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-06
  • City: COLORADO SPRINGS
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOLE TRANSPORT LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver had completed delivery of gasoline to Maverik gas station. As he was draining his hose after the trailer was emptied he dropped the hose spilling the contents of the hose roughly 2 gallons. Driver was able to use his spill kit and soak up the fuel that was spilled. This only impacted concrete no dirt or drain was impacted.
